Package com.dwilliam.utils

Interface Try<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Failure, Success
    public interface Try<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Optional<T> asOptional()
      Returns an Optional containing the value if this Try is a Success or an empty Optional if this Try is a Failure.
      void consume​(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
      Performs the given action on the value if this Try is a Success.
      boolean contains​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
      Returns true if this Try is a Success and the value match the given predicate, false otherwise.
      boolean containsThrowable​(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> predicate)
      Returns true if this Try is a Failure and the the caught Throwable match the given predicate, false otherwise.
      Try<java.lang.Throwable> failed()
      Inverts this Try.
      Try<T> filter​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
      Converts this to a Failure if the predicate on the value is not satisfied.
      Try<T> filterThrowable​(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> predicate)
      Converts this to a Failure if the predicate on the throwable is not satisfied.
      <U> Try<U> flatMap​(TryFunction<? super T,​? extends Try<U>> mapper)
      Likes flatMap(Function<? super T, ? extends Try<U>>) but with a TryFunction.
      <U> Try<U> flatMap​(java.util.function.Function<? super T,​? extends Try<U>> mapper)
      Maps the given function to the value if it's a Success or returns this if it's a Failure.
      T get()
      Returns the value from this Success or throws the caught Throwable in case of Failure.
      T getOrElse​(T elseValue)
      Returns the value if this Try is a Success or the given elseValue argument if this Try is a Failure.
      java.lang.Throwable getThrowable()
      Returns the throwable from this Failure or throws a UnsupportedOperationException if this Try is a Success.
      boolean isFailure()
      Returns true if this Try is a Failure.
      boolean isSuccess()
      Returns true if this Try is a Success.
      <U> Try<U> map​(TryFunction<? super T,​? extends U> mapper)
      Likes map(Function<? super T, ? extends U>) but with a TryFunction.
      <U> Try<U> map​(java.util.function.Function<? super T,​? extends U> mapper)
      Maps the given function to the value if it's a Success or returns this if it's a Failure.
      Try<T> mapThrowable​(TryFunction<? super java.lang.Throwable,​? extends java.lang.Throwable> mapper)
      Likes mapThrowable(Function<? super T, ? extends Throwable>) but with a TryFunction.
      Try<T> mapThrowable​(java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.Throwable,​? extends java.lang.Throwable> mapper)
      Maps the given function to the throwable if it's a Failure or returns this if it's a Success.
      static <T> Try<T> newTry​(TrySupplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Tries some code.
      static <T> Try<T> of​(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Tries some code.
      default Try<T> orElse​(Try<T> elseTry)
      Returns this Try if it's a Success or the given elseTry argument if it's a @code Failure}.
      Try<T> recover​(TryFunction<? super java.lang.Throwable,​? extends T> mapper)
      Likes recover(Function<? super Throwable, ? extends T>) but with a TryFunction
      Try<T> recover​(TrySupplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Likes recover(Supplier<U>) but with a TrySupplier
      Try<T> recover​(java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.Throwable,​? extends T> mapper)
      Returns a new Try build with the specified mapper if this is a Failure.
      Try<T> recover​(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Returns a new Try build with the specified supplier if this is a Success.
      Try<T> recoverValue​(T value)
      Returns a new Success build with the specified value if this is a Failure.
      <U> Try<U> then​(TrySupplier<U> supplier)
      Likes then(Supplier<U>) but with a TrySupplier

      Returns a new Try build with the specified supplier if this is a Success.

      Likes thenThrowable(Supplier<Throwable>) but with a TrySupplier

      Returns a new Try build with the specified supplier if this is a Failure.

      Returns an Optional containing the throwable if this Try is a Failure or an empty Optional if this Try is a Success.

      Throws the caught Throwable if this Try is a Failure or throws a UnsupportedOperationException if this Try is a Success.

      Performs the given action on the caught Throwable if this Try is a Failure.

      Tries a value.

        Returns the throwable from this Failure or throws a UnsupportedOperationException if this Try is a Success.
        Returns:
        the throwable if this Try is a Failure
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this Try is a Success

      • throwThrowable

        default void throwThrowable()
                     throws java.lang.Throwable
        Throws the caught Throwable if this Try is a Failure or throws a UnsupportedOperationException if this Try is a Success.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this Try is a Success
        java.lang.Throwable - if this Try is a Failure

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • throwableAsOptional

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Throwable> throwableAsOptional()
        Returns an Optional containing the throwable if this Try is a Failure or an empty Optional if this Try is a Success.
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the value if this Try is a Failure or an empty Optional if this Try is a Success

        Returns this Try if it's a Success or the given elseTry argument if it's a @code Failure}.
        Parameters:
        elseTry - the Try that will be return if this Try is a Failure
        Returns:

      • map

        <U> Try<U> map​(java.util.function.Function<? super T,​? extends U> mapper)
        Maps the given function to the value if it's a Success or returns this if it's a Failure.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the value returned from the mapping function
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function to apply to a value, if present
        Returns:
        a new Try if it's a Success or this if it's a Failure
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the mapping function is null

      • consume

        void consume​(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
        Performs the given action on the value if this Try is a Success. Does nothing if this Try is a Failure.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The action
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified action is null

      • trap

        void trap​(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> consumer)
        Performs the given action on the caught Throwable if this Try is a Failure. Does nothing if this Try is a Success. It's like void consume(Consumer<T>); for the Throwable.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The action
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified action is null

      • contains

        boolean contains​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Returns true if this Try is a Success and the value match the given predicate, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate which test the value.
        Returns:
        true if this Try is a Success and the value match the given predicate, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified predicate is null

      • containsThrowable

        boolean containsThrowable​(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> predicate)
        Returns true if this Try is a Failure and the the caught Throwable match the given predicate, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate which test the the caught Throwable.
        Returns:
        true if this Try is a Failure and the the caught Throwable match the given predicate, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified predicate is null

      • filter

        Try<T> filter​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Converts this to a Failure if the predicate on the value is not satisfied.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate which test the value.
        Returns:
        this if it's a Failure or if it's a Success and the value match the given predicate, a Failure containing a NoSuchElementException otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified predicate is null

      • filterThrowable

        Try<T> filterThrowable​(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Throwable> predicate)
        Converts this to a Failure if the predicate on the throwable is not satisfied.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate which test the throwable.
        Returns:
        this if it's a Failure and the the caught Throwable match the given predicate, a Failure containing a UnsupportedOperationException if it's a Success, a Failure containing a NoSuchElementException otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified predicate is null

      • thenValue

        <U> Try<U> thenValue​(U value)
        Returns a new Success build with the specified value if this is a Success. Returns this if it's a Failure.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the value
        Parameters:
        value - a supplier used to make the new Try
        Returns:
        a new Try if this is a Success, this if it's a Failure

      • failed

        Try<java.lang.Throwable> failed()
        Inverts this Try. Returns its exception wrapped in a Success if it's a Failure or a Failure containing an UnsupportedOperationException if it's a Success.
        Returns:
        a Try<Throwable>
